DataElement.preferredName: Image Axilla Scan Side Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric code to indicate laterality of axilla scanned.  [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device of the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.:Pictures of structures inside the body. Scans often used in diagnosing, staging, and monitoring disease include liver scans, bone scans, and computed tomography (CT) or computerized axial tomography (CAT) scans and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans. In liver scanning and bone scanning, radioactive substances that are injected into the bloodstream collect in these organs. A scanner that detects the radiation is used to create pictures. In CT scanning, an x-ray machine linked to a computer is used to produce detailed pictures of organs inside the body. MRI scans use a large magnet connected to a computer to create pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk 10/31/12 Released as part of draft VD review with Tina Taylor.  8/1/07-created to support ACRIN Breast US data elements.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numeric code to indicate which axillary side examined in the study. [Manually-curated]

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hollow under both arms where it is joined to the shoulder.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk 10/31/12 Released as part of draft VD review with Tina Taylor.  3/18/07 - Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If yes[axilla scanned], code
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes[axilla scanned], code side scanned.
